Job Title: Senior Energy Engineer

Location: New York City Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Engineering, Project Management

Description:
Senior Energy Engineer- Mechanical/ Performance InfrastructureHybrid position Located in either Metro NYC, Boston MA or Philadelpia PA Areas
Our client is a global leader in the Energy Industry. Their Energy Services Company (ESCO) dedicated to working with owners to reduce facility operating costs by offering design and construction management for a full range of comprehensive energy conservation measures.
Our Client is looking for a Senior Energy Engineer in USA, Oklahoma preferably. 
RESPONSIBILITIES:-Under minimal direction, designs conceptual solutions for customers based on customer needs and team direction and strategies.-Manages the development of a compelling business case for the proposed scope of work.-Leads and manages the development of projects utilizing Engineering Pool resources and Subject Matter Energy Experts as needed to efficiently and cost effectively deliver projects from inception through close.-Responsible for development budget and timeline. Has an advanced understanding of the full range of Company's capabilities (e.g., energy management, renewable, CHP, building automation systems, services, operations and maintenance, finance, facilities management, etc.) and is able to combine these capabilities to solve critical customer needs.-Must also have demonstrated ability to lead this process and review the detailed work.-Possesses a strong understanding of the solutions performance contracting regulatory, legislative and business environment, as well as procurement requirements.-The Principal Development Engineer is jointly accountable for increasing secured sales and margin metrics, accountable for incorporating more Company's capabilities into customer solutions, shortening the solution development cycle, increasing win rates, applying appropriate solution "best practices" and minimizing development costs.How you will do it-Develops the initial Order of Energy assessments during the Qualify phase.-Acts as the Project Development Lead and point of contact throughout the project development.-Develops and engineers smaller opportunities using Engineering Pool resources as appropriate to develop within projected costs and schedule, and provide a final solution consistent with Customerâ€™s procurement process.-For large, complex, or "high opportunity" projects, leads teams of subject matter experts, pool.
 REQUIREMENTS:-Bachelor's degree in Engineering - Mechanical Plus-10+ years of engineering, construction, and facility operations, with excellent knowledge of building-related systems and services.-PE, CEM, LEED AP certification which is a plus.-Proven track record as project manager handling multiple projects involving energy solutions within the HVAC/Building Automation industry.-Must have solid knowledge of regulatory, legislative and business environment.-Possesses strong project management skills for managing large development projects with diverse resources.-Strong conceptual skills required for developing innovative solution designs.-Has excellent customer-facing skills and is comfortable presenting at the C-level.-Strong team leader, able to quickly assemble and manage a solution development team as required.-Has excellent business analysis skills used to create compelling business cases-Ability to travel up to 30 - 40%, primarily within Region.-Mostly day travel with approximately 10% overnight travel.-Experience with public sector vertical markets a plus. K-12 and local government vertical markets

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
